author: surlypants
body:
enable support for chocolately delivered shims (https://chocolatey.org/docs/features-shim)

path set as:
$env:Path = "C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-alpha.18;C:\Program Files\OpenSSH-Win64"

allows new-pssession to successfully call ssh.exe (directly)

path set as:
$env:Path = "C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-alpha.18;C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\bin;C:\Program Files\OpenSSH-Win64"

prevents new-pssession from calling ssh.exe (via chocolately-delivered shim), with error:

The background process reported an error with the following message: The SSH client session has ended with error message: The input line is too long..

$psversiontable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
CLRVersion

WSManStackVersion              3.0


(Get-Command ssh).Path
C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\bin\ssh.exe

ssh -V
OpenSSH_7.5p1, OpenSSL 1.0.2d 9 Jul 2015

surlypants
comments.body:
it would appear to me that https://chocolatey.org/packages/openssh does in fact deliver shimmed EXEs. hence this report.

$ choco search ssh |grep mls

mls-software-openssh 7.5.1.1 [Approved] Downloads cached for licensed users


$ choco list -lo |grep ssh

openssh 0.0.12.0



** EDIT **

thanks for the tip, the ssh shim clobbering was due to rsync. removal of said package and we're back in business.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body:
In your original post `ssh -V` delivered `OpenSSH_7.5p1` so I assumed it was that package - good work finding the original culprit.

For anyone else following or finding this thread - the openssh chocolatey package does not generate shims.

Apologies @bagajjal - I can't help myself but to loop in our conversation here https://github.com/DarwinJS/ChocoPackages/issues/28 - to this case in point of why I am not a fan of using the path for any critical runtime dependencies.
